channel.title: [Project] Chatroom
channel.description:
I have been working on Davidi2's old chatroom to improve its functionality, and over-all style to the average user.
Client UI: [img]http://soharuda.webuda.com/wp-content/uploads/2011/08/clientupdate2.png[/img]
[b][i]Changed in client:[/i][/b] Added background Removed drawing of some components (still there, just not drawn) Added smileys (anybody feel like helping me with ones themed to the UI?) *currently loaded via web, will implement my cache format soon and compress them with the JAR Added a bit of inflation/deflation to the send/received packets to save a minute amount of bandwidth (i have hardly any)
[b][i]Change in server:[/i][/b] Improved user profiles *instead of only containing a password, it now contains the users rights, muted time left, and if the user is permanently muted Added a numeric password encryption I have been working on *not reversable, it uses the password length, first 4 letter, last letter, and the entire password as a whole within the math process User owned rooms started *I am working out tabs within the client to be able to join multiple rooms (I want tabs to be themed to the client, or I'd just add it now)

item.title: [Project] Chatroom
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

If I decide to make idle tags I may change the username orientation, but for now it will stay how it is. Centered orientation of text is more for poems or songs. Not a list of something.

Read full topic

item.title: [Project] Chatroom
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

A small NIO implementation would be great as I have not worked with writing a server until now lol. I’ve been using your base as an example (not example as in just re-writing bits of code, but to figure things out when I get stuck) with packets. Making the entire thing around an ArrayList instead of a user array this time as well. Just seems to work out better.

Read full topic

item.title: [Project] Chatroom
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Your best option is to rewrite the entire thing. Or I have a simple asynchronous-IO (NIO) implementation I could give you, but you’d need to edit it and create packet handlers/creators and such.

Read full topic

item.title: [Project] Chatroom
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Davidi2:

You’ll have to either rewrite the server or get someone to do it for you, unless I misinterpreted that last sentence.

I have written a "method’ or this into the original server by creating a new class. I have a new server in progress with ‘native’ support, as well as its much more stable. For some reason (rare, but it happens) your server will go into an endless loop when a client connects. Not freeznig the server, but never fully logging them in. They can just close the client and re-connect, but its still something I want to get rid of.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:

item.title: [Project] Chatroom
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

The issue is, many people use xat because it does have a appeal for being able to ‘own’ your own room and add a custom wallpaper. I figure if I include these features then my efforts wont be for more than practice.

Read full topic

item.title: [Project] Chatroom
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

CoonHunter:

The only real problem with legibility is the black font, but making the font bold erased that issue. I have taken classes in photoshop, photography, and page layout. All of which are much easier than designing the UI. If you look at xat.com you will see where I got the idea. I will look onto a better background later but that came from 2 minutes of fiddling in photoshop.

i’m probably not alone when i say that i’ve noticed that xat chatboxes look absolutely horrendous. the awful icons, the dirty backgrounds all of the annoying bleeps and boops which make it great for 12 year old server owners and an eyesore for anyone better.

Read full topic

item.title: [Project] Chatroom
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:17, topic:407645”][quote author=_s link=topic=508922.msg3693275#msg3693275 date=1312259433]

how ugly, it’s evident you know fuck all about design.

Its evident I could give a shit about your opinion.

you could give a shit? ok, that’s cool.
[/quote]
Its a phrase, or does your wannabe intellect make the front of your brain useless. Therefor not detecting forms of sarcasm? Please, make criticism or just stop posting. You make yourself look like a incompetent moron.[/quote]
it’s funny because what you should have said is that you couldn’t give shit and then we’d have all got the point; you could give a shit is always interpreted as either a typo or just plain bad english so detecting any sarcasm in it’s usage is going to be hard. sigh. also, i think there are more than 2 people who respect me however feel free to prove me wrong. ps it’s funny watching someone dumb call other people dumb.

Davidi2:

Design is usually all in the eye of the beholder, everyone can have their opinion, but nobody can be right. It’s nothing to get angry over.

design is always in the eye of the beholder but i think anyone can distinguish something made by someone with a sense of design and something made by someone without a sense of design. that awful red bubble pattern behind decreases legibility and generally just looks bad, it’s a shame coonhunter can’t see that himself.

Read full topic
